author: Adam Savage’s Tested
description:
We go hands-on with the Meta Ray-Ban Display glasses, the next evolution of Meta’s smart glasses with a full color heads-up display embedded in the right side lens. They’re also the first product to make use of a neural wristband to control the glasses interface, reading micro gestures from your hand that feels like a brand new computer control paradigm. We dive deep and dissect how these technologies work, and once again sit down for a technical conversation with Boz, Meta’s Chief Technology Officer. 

Shot by Josh Self and edited by Norman Chan
Music by Jinglepunks
Additional media courtesy of Meta

title: Hands-On: Meta Ray-Ban Display Smart Glasses!
